description:
Summary: 
Click the "Start" button on the left side of the taskbar.
The user opened the Control Panel by clicking on the "Control Panel" option within the Windows XP Start Menu.
Hover over the "Appearance and Themes" icon in the Windows XP Control Panel to view a tooltip describing its function.
The user opened the "Display" settings within the "Appearance and Themes" section of the Windows Control Panel.
The user opened the "Display Properties" window and selected the "Screen Saver" tab.
To change the screensaver, open the "Display Properties" window, go to the "Screen Saver" tab, and click the down arrow next to "Windows XP" to choose a different screensaver from the dropdown menu.
The user navigated to the "Screen Saver" tab within the "Display Properties" dialog box and clicked the "Power" button located in the "Monitor power" section.

Summary: Within the "Power Options Properties" window, under the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme, the user is accessing the dropdown menu for the "Turn off monitor" setting to likely choose a time duration.
The user set the system to hibernate after 5 hours under the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme within the "Power Options Properties" window.
The user is attempting to save the current power scheme settings by clicking the "Save As..." button within the "Power Options Properties" dialog box, specifically while on the "Power Schemes" tab.
The user selected the "Always On" power scheme from the dropdown menu within the "Power Schemes" tab of the "Power Options Properties" window.
The user opened the "Turn off hard disks:" dropdown menu within the "Always On" power scheme settings of the Power Options Properties window.

To adjust the automatic monitor turn-off time, open the "Power Options Properties" dialog box, go to the "Power Schemes" tab, and click the dropdown menu arrow next to the "Turn off monitor:" setting.
The user disabled system hibernation by setting the "System hibernates:" option to "Never" in the Power Options Properties window.
The user deactivated the screen saver feature and confirmed the changes by clicking "OK" in the "Display Properties" dialog box.
The user closed the "Appearance and Themes" window by clicking the red "X" button in the top-right corner.
